content: you think the shot look sinister enough the plight of many a crafting DM is
having far more inspiration and ideas than time to build you have an epic set
piece pictured in your mind awesome 3d terrain elements that you want to drop
on your table but the games coming up this Saturday and you're not even close
to being done crafting so what do you do well you work your butt off you stay up
too late and you get er done because that's how you do it this is a problem
we all know but it's a good problem if it's these moments that force you into
getting done it's these moments that force you to find creative and
efficient ways to build your train so we must never complain about this problem
however there is another problem that plagues a crafting DM that luckily it
doesn't rise too often at least not for me and that's when you have the opposite
problem you all of a sudden find yourself with lots of time to build but
you have no ideas maybe your story and your campaign is on hold momentarily and
you don't know where it's headed next so you don't know what it is you need to
build so what do you do well I recently found myself in the same conundrum my
party had just finished what was a several session long adventure and I
knew that at the next session we would be starting something new and I didn't
know what that was yet and we were going into the holiday season so game I'll put
on hold which meant rather than the two weeks or
so I had between sessions I found myself with
three or four possibly five weeks I knew I had a lot of time to build but I
didn't know yet where I was gonna be sending my party what kind of adventure
they'd be going on so I sat at the table with all this time and I was just blank
but didn't let that stop me when I find myself in this sort of situation I find
the best thing to do is to just start building now you have no idea so you
can't build anything so what do you do you know when you're in that creative
frenzy and your hands just can't keep up to your brain and you have all these
ideas and then all of a sudden you have to do some menial tasks like cut
shingles it totally ruins the bottom so when you're in a situation we have no
creativity but lots of time that's the perfect time to do these tasks even if
you don't know what you're planning on building in the future just start during
one of these menial repetitive material tasks get your foam and cut shingles cut
wood beams cut bricks whatever just something to utilize the time and that's
what I did I have no idea what to build so I just started cutting bricks I made
a huge tub of them I have no idea what they'd be for but I knew they'd be
useful and the great thing about doing this instead of just pissing off and
watching a movie when you don't have inspiration is that after you've been
doing this for a while you will become inspired again you're a crafter you just
can't help it so I cut several hundred bricks and by the end of it I started
seeing and there it was the spark of
inspiration I didn't have plans on taking my party to a chapel really
sinister creepy Chapel but when I was cutting these bricks that's what came to
mind and then I started building and I got into that awesome creative zone
where I was able to utilize that time work on a project and put a lot of
detail in it because I wasn't under any time constraints but that is my advice
to you and you don't know what to build just build bricks build shingles
anything and then put them on the shelf well you're ready till you're inspired
and hopefully you won't even have to wait long maybe inspirational strike
right away so anyway this is my latest build this creepy ass sinister Chapel
that you know is infested with cultists or demons so why don't we zoom in and
take a close look and I'll show you some of the things I did on it
